snippet: Jaime Avila Jr. bought two weapons found at the scene of a Border Patrol agent’s killing and later linked to the botched gun-trafficking operation known as Fast and Furious.
abstract: Jamie Avila Jr, man who bought two weapons found at scene of Border Patrol agent Brian Terry's killing and subsequently linked to botched gun-trafficking investigation Operation Fast and Furious, is sentenced to 57 months in federal prison, closing another chapter in case that became political firestorm.
lead_paragraph: Jaime Avila Jr. bought two weapons found at the scene of a Border Patrol agent’s killing and later linked to the botched gun-trafficking operation known as Fast and Furious.

headline.seo: Prison Term in Gun-Trafficking Case Tied to Border Patrol Agent’s Killing
headline.main: Prison Term in Guns Case Tied to Agent’s Killing
headline.print_headline: Prison Term in Guns Case Tied to Agent’s Killing
